comment.author: 75421485@N08
comment._content: This photograph was taken during Thursday practice for the 1929 RIAC Irish International Grand Prix. Malcolm CampEll drove this Sunbeam in the race.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/75421485@N08] Brilliant! You've given us a date, car model...

Any idea on a more exact date in 1929??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 75421485@N08
comment._content: Thursday July 11th 1929. Campbell retired from the race on Saturday July 13th "with a slipping clutch and a spluttering engine".

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/75421485@N08] Excellent, Bob! We love exact dates.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 58930216@N04
comment._content: This year, 2012, marks 100 years of racing in the Phoenix Park. Hopefully the entire circuit will be nicely resurfaced in time for the planned event in August!
